content.description: Good climbing with the crux clipping the anchor. Best to have pre-placed the anchor slings from the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts to anchor on top of cliff for easy TR set-up.
content.location: 6th route from the left in the small corridor to the far left of the Alcove. You will face north while in front of this route.

content.description: Shares anchors with Lady Bug.  Very difficult for the grade.
content.location: Located next to Lady bug in the small corridor that is to the far left of the main Alcove (routes on the right and huge boulders on the left) Ursa Minor shares anchors with Lady Bug and starts 10' to the right, 2nd route from the left. Standing in front of this route you will be facing west.

content.description: Odd start to a good crimpy face above.
Crux start and at 3rd bolt. Technical climbing with an Iron cross move.
content.protection: 4 bolts to chain anchor. Can be set up for TR.
content.location: 8th and last route from the left in the small corridor to the far left of the Alcove. Starts about 10' to the right of Bizzaro on a blank face moves up and left to the only other set of chain anchors in the corridor.

content.description: Can lead this climb on marginal gear for first 20' then good hand size to top. Bolted for beginners.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchor on top for easy TR set-up
content.location: 4th route from the left in the small corridor to the far left of the alcove. You will be facing north while standing in front of this route. This route starts in the corner, and to the right is a blank face which is 5.13 the anchor on the 13 has a 2 bolt anchor. Lichen the jam beging to the left.

content.description: Helps to have a positive ape index. Watch out for poison oak to the left of the start.
content.location: Located to the far left of the main alcove ( The Corridor). This is the small corridor with the routes on the right and large boulders on the left. Lady Bug is the first route starting from the left. It is also the only route that has a chain anchor below the top of the cliff as the other climbs have the anchors on the top of the cliff. Standing in front of this route you will be facing west.

content.description: Fun Crack climbing in small dihedral
content.protection: Top-Rope or Trad, chain anchor on top.

content.description: Weird start help to be tall.

content.protection: 4 bolts to anchor on top for easy top rope set-up
content.location: This is the 3rd route from the left in the small corridor to the far left of the main Alcove. Standing in front of this route you will be facing north and a thin slab is the start.

climbs.name: Dudditz
climbs.fa: Bolts chopped and removed (unknown) Re-bolted by Michael May (summer 2003)

content.description: Stick clip first bolt, crux is the boulder problem start.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: 5th route from the left in small corridor to the far left on the Alcove. You will be facing north standing in front of this climb. This route stands out because of the 2 bolt anchor on the top.

content.protection: 4 bolts, shares anchor with Where's Jake
content.location: 7th route from the left in small corridor to the far left of the Alcove. Standing in front of this route you will be facing west. Thin slab start.

pathTokens: Twin Falls and the Snake River Canyon
